intro: Verbesina etlana, commonly known as the Etlan sunflower, is a striking plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, bright yellow ray flowers and dark green, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its tall, erect stem can reach heights of up to 3 meters, making it a prominent feature in its native habitat. Verbesina etlana is also noted for its medicinal properties and historical use by indigenous peoples.
